item.title: Giant diamond fails to sell at auction
item.description: [AAP] - The biggest uncut diamond to be discovered in over a century has failed to sell at a Sotheby's auction. Sotheby's had estimated that the diamond, found last November at Lucara's mine in Botswana, would sell for more than $US70 million. "The fact that the stone didn't sell, yes, it is disappointing but it doesn't change anything for Lucara as a company," Lucara CEO William Lamb said.
